reviews.review: The trailers spoil the first two acts of the movie almost entirely, leaving an underwhelming third act to tie things up. Sadly marketing ruined this one for me

I‚Äôd not read the book or seen the 1980s movie before watching Rami Maalek‚Äôs version so this was new ground, as it were. Definitely worth seeing. Solid performances all around and more suspenseful than I expected. Still, I wanted to read the original novel before reviewing the movie and I‚Äôm glad I did; the original book delves more into why the blackmail works that wasn‚Äôt explored enough in the movie. (No spoilers; let‚Äôs just say that what a writer would consider enough to blackmail top CIA officials in the 70s is called Tuesday in the 21st century‚Äôs CIA!ü§£) Good enough for a widescreen tv but I was impressed with the‚Äôbig screen experience.‚Äù
Fun movie. Some action and overall very enjoyable.
Great little spy thriller. Perfect for a matinee.

Watch it? Rent it? Skip it? Skip it. That was such a huge waste of a free movie ticket. The Amateur is about a pencil neck, computer geek working for the CIA who becomes an International CIA Agent overnight in order to find and kill those who killed his wife. Sounds stupid? You‚Äôre right. It is. It was. Somehow over a 2 hour period Rami Malek, an academy award winner, is transformed into a bullet proof CIA spy using his skills he learned from Lawrence Fishburne over a period of a few days and the help of YouTube videos (seriously). Jon Berthnal has a couple of very regrettable appearances, seriously, just a couple. Needless to say Rami learns how to hack into every building, access every camera, to evade the highly trained CIA agents sent to find him. He is bulletproof. Literally escaping a Seal team with automatic weapons. Ugh. It is just so cringe worthy. I feel more stupider just writing this. This was crap. Just total crap. A waste of 2 hours and a free movie ticket. Don‚Äôt waste your time or money watching this stupidity.
Great twists and turns!! Loved it!
Incredible!!!! Edge of your seat the entire movie‚Ä¶..Will purchase when released!!!
It was better than expected, definitely enjoyed the ‚Äúcerebral‚Äù twist on the spy thriller genre.

The movie started a bit slow, but once it hit its stride, it held my attention the rest of the way. I found some parts of the plot to be somewhat difficult to follow. I could see the effects, but (to me), the causes needed more setup. Also, the suspense and musical background noise often obscured the dialogue.

The Amateur has its flaws, but it is well acted and holds true to the novel it is based on. Of course any movie in this category is going to considered far fetched, as there are certainly some thoughts on this particular installment doubling down on that notion. I found it enjoyable, and Rami Malek is good in just about anything he does.

I am begging directors to let Rami Malek off the leash. Mr. Robot showed us how much talent this man has, but no one since Esmail has been able to pull that level of performance out of him. This movie gets a solid B from me, but man. Knowing how strong and formidable he is as an actor, I walk away from most performances disappointed. Give him more to work with, and push him hard. He won't disappoint.
Great storyline and character development. Loved how it all came together at the end.
Just never got into the story or the main character. Did like the ending as that seemed the most believable.

The movie was a fun watch, probably better than most movies in the theater at the moment. It was slow in some parts, I felt like they could have used this time to do more character development or even make the story a bit more complex. They could have done more will the main character's skill set to make the plot more unique. There was a random CIA character in the beginning that showed up later and then disappeared, didn't have any actual role in the story.. kind of odd, a missed opportunity perhaps. Rami Malek and most of the actors deliver, but I can't say the same for the movie's writing.

[SPOILER - Light] This film was a lot of fun up to the final act, where it seemed to take a turn from good, to just ok. The story does well enough to present the protagonist as a fish out of water, while simultaneously setting up his love for puzzles. Then it expects you to believe he masterminded his whole revenge plot on a whim, conveniently traveled the world, got allies killed without any extra remorse, and rides off into the sunset like Jet Li out of War. Come to think of it, the films have similar themes. They put the best kills in the trailer and open with the weakest, where he's still a fish out of water. The film was really back and forth about his capability.

The Amateur isn‚Äôt a terrible movie, but it felt disjointed and lacked cohesion. The story follows a high-IQ computer nerd who decides to become an assassin after his wife is killed. Though he‚Äôs not a trained killer, he sets out on a revenge mission, taking out his targets using unconventional methods. He manages to eliminate three out of the four people responsible for her death. When he finally confronts the main culprit in the climax, rather than exacting personal justice, he turns the killer over to the government. It‚Äôs an odd choice that feels unearned and anticlimactic, leaving viewers wondering, Why? The movie lacks suspense, the plot doesn‚Äôt fully come together, and it ultimately falls short of its potential. It might have worked better as a straight-to-streaming release rather than a theatrical experience.
The ending was unexpected and better than I expected. It seems we've found our new Jason Bourne.

I thoroughly enjoyed the movie. I was engaged by the story and did not think of this as a "revenge movie" or "spy thriller". I did not compare it to any other movie......I went to the movie and was moved by the story. Loved Rami Malek and felt the sorrow and madness of losing a loved one. His character was using his genius for a questionable CIA operation. In becoming a vigilante, he becomes a fuller person and may be fighting back against organized evil. There were no half pornographic love making scenes, even when he's in bed with women spy he meets. The good guy wins! What a movie! Go see it yourself!

I‚Äôve almost stopped going to the cinema. Every movie is either a cartoon movie (whether it‚Äôs animated or just another twist on a comic book or a game) or a horror flick. FINALLY, an action movie‚Ä¶with good actors and something for adults. Well done!
Nice suspenseful action film with surprises around each corner.
It was an amazing action movie!

So they fridge his wife (the unfortunate Rachel Brosnahan), then the mild-mannered analyst becomes a vendetta machine. We really like many of the actors, but this script was insulting. The world doesn't need another Liam Neeson revenge film, and Rami Malik does not need to try to be Liam Neeson. Even Liam Neeson doesn't need to make any more of those stupid revenge movies! There are some smart bits (thus the half-star), but what kind of entitled idiot thinks he's got the right to go out and kill people because a loved one dies? Or that he even has a chance to actually succeed?? I would not buy that Rami Malik could do any of this, or that anyone with a brain would want to try. Lastly, the idea that everyone in the CIA is ethically and morally good except for a few bad apples is possibly the most insulting bit of all. (We saw this at the drive-in, which automatically improves movies by at least 30%, so had we paid to see this in an indoor theater, I'd have been even angrier at it.)

Very slow movie I expected the amateur to become something other than the amateur, but he seemed to stay the amateur the entire movie. I didnt fall asleep so thats a good sign at least all in all affair movie but I wouldve liked to have seen more action.

My family really didn't want to watch it. Well, afterwards, everyone had enjoyed the movie! Lots of action, great plot and story development, the main character was a phenomenal actor! I'll watch again when it comes out on video to see if I missed any of the clues during the movie!

spoilers ahead. Summary: it's bad. Full review: Unfortunately one of the worst films I've seen in a long time. The first 5 minutes showcase stiff and unemotional acting from Rachel Brosnahan and Rami Malek. Thankfully we don't see them on the screen together after this, but they packed enough clich√©s and cheesy dialogue to make up for it. Each line felt like it was just being remembered not acted. The rest of the movie feels similar. We are introduced to a cast of characters, foes, villains and allies who end up being pretty much inconsequential throughout the whole movie. Even the characters who seem like they would be very important seem to only suggest their importance and then maybe appear once more in the movie for almost no reason - John Bernthal's characters being the biggest sinner here. The movie hints he's a pretty friendly but badass agent who Rami Malek is perhaps envious of, or wants to be pals with. He turns up later not for a cool action scene, not too bring Malek on and be defeated in some cool way, not to join Malek and lend him his very cool agent skills - but just to tell the guy to give it up, and the conversation simply ends because Malek says 'nah', so Bernthal let's him walk away. That's it. It's a tiny scene in the middle of the movie, and we never see that character again. Laurence Fishburn also has an extremely disappointing lack of screen time; his story line is seriously confusing and lacks development - he is introduced to train our character, after which he follows our character as if he's trying to turn him in, he suddenly saves our character by what seems like betraying the CIA, he turns up at the end to say 'well done protagonist, you proved me wrong and you really are the coolest guy'. We have no understanding why or when he decided to help Rami Malek considering Malek was getting away from him the whole beginning of the film. The actual villains that Malek is trying to find are all of course foreign, and also not a threat at all. The most stakes there was at any point is with the woman he went after first because she scratched his face up a bit before being hit by s car, conveniently. The rest of his revenge killings just kind of happen, there is no trouble travelling, no trouble finding the baddies, no fighting and barely any negotiating. The final villain which is corruption at the CIA also just is fixed at the end, and despite us knowing thet betrayed and killed allies abroad secretly, we are reassured that patriotism and the American dream will prevail after all.
Rami Malek delivers in his important role, but the plot dampens and loses it‚Äôs interest towards the end.
decent action, good cast, a bit of sloppy story holds it back
Intriguing movie. Some plot holes. Good start to finish.
Great movie Rami malek was awsome

The Amateur is a slick, globe-trotting revenge thriller that offers a fresh spin on the espionage genre, powered by strong performances by Remi Malek and Laurence Fishburne, as well as its inventive special effects, but the film is hampered by a predictable plot with implausible leaps in logic.
This movie was a different take on your normal action thriller the lead character put his MacGyver sense into it, and his next move was surprising every time.
A thriller from start to finish and Rami Malek was phenomenal in his role once again.
Brilliant! Unique plot. Must see on the big screen!
Surprising a solid movie to watch. It gives an artistic perspective on how corrupt the CIA is. The plot was a lil slow here and there so that keeps me from rating it higher.

Solid flick. Good watch!

Once again, a film proves that you should never read the critics' reviews, only the audience consensus. When I read that this movie is about the CIA, I figured it would be dull and over my head. But Rami Malek was a joy to watch in his role, is there anything he can't do? Action packed and so interesting.
Kept you waiting with anticipation. Good movie. Could see it again, I can't say that about too many movies!

Great movie. Well acted and well written. Pacing and story are spot on. I really enjoyed this movie.

I watched the film solely because of Caitriona Balfe, whom I consider an extraordinarily talented actress. She demonstrated that in Outlander and reaffirmed it in Belfast. In this film, however, she was practically invisible. It highlighted just how important it is not only to choose the right roles, but also the right co-stars. Rami Malek is an actor who gives nothing to anyone. As a result, the film ends up being completely unwatchable. Still, a bad script, poor direction, and terrible casting didn‚Äôt faze Laurence Fishburne, who delivered a professional performance despite the uninspiring material.
I absolutely loved this movie, it kept me guessing and the story line though sad and heart breaking was very well written ‚ù§Ô∏èüëçüèΩ

This was surprisingly dull. No attempt to emotionally connect the viewer with Malik‚Äôs mission; boring villains, if they were even developed at all; and the too-few action scenes are in the trailer. I love the concept and that they tried to make an original film, just wish it was better.
Such a well done movie. Kept me on the edge of my seat the whole time.

I don't know what to say, except that I liked it more than I thought I would after reading some negative reviews. It started off slow, but it picked up considerably in the second half of the movie and didn't go as I expected. The Amateur is a movie I wanted to like, because I like action-thrillers, but sadly I ended up disliking this one. I heard bad things about it, but I didn't care, because I tend to like these kind of movies. Unfortunately the movie is boring for the most part. The story is simple, the tension was on a very low level. The only thing that surprised me was the way the main character did what he did. A big part of my problems is because of the trailer. There is just too much in it and I've seen it in the cinema too many times. So in many scenes I knew what would happen. The characters are not well-written. I couldn't get attached to Heller, so that's also a big part of why I was bored. A movie like this should be a lot more tense, there were only a few intense or exciting scenes. The film should also be a lot shorter. The score is good, but a bit too epic sometimes. Finally the casting is the best aspect. The supporting cast including Jon Bernthal, Laurence Fishburne, Holt McCallany and Caitriona Balfe elevated their scenes very much. The Amateur was promising because of its cast, but ended up being boring and uninteresting.

I really like this movie. Lots of action in suspense. Look, the plot might be a little far-fetched. However, that‚Äôs why we go to the movies! I really like how we got to see a change in the main character, an increase in maturity, as he progressed through the story. Good job by the actor and the director.
Loved the suspense, the twists and turns, and the acting was superb. I would watch it again.

The Amateur is a revenge story highly suited on the magnetic personality of Rami Malek. And in that sense, I loved it. You want to see him complete his job for sure. The script lacks some stakes in the second part and the finale felt rushed. But it works and it satisfies. Good.

Overall, it's a decent movie. It's hard to be passionate about Rami Malek's character. It's difficult to find him credible. You might want more of Inquiline played by Caitriona Balfe. Her piece is perhaps some of the most intriguing and could have (maybe should have) been the substance of dual heroes. And you might leave disappointed that Jon Bernthal's character is seemingly some sort of red herring. What the heck was that all about? The ending with Laurence Fishburne is fairly unsatisfying. And you might feel like the character played by Adrian Martinez should have had something more. The filming and scene cuts almost make you believe that certainly there will be, and then there isn't. But, it's a clever story with decent action and an interesting twist on the Jason Bourne-espe type thriller from a conspiracy perspective.

You could really sense his frustration of his own department's no worries "We got this handled" attitude and his anger when he discovers the truth. Refreshing to see justice served in a very intelligient manner as opposed to the regular muscle, guns, physical violence action we are used to seeing.

The film tells the story of Charlie Heller, played by Rami Malek, whom you may know, among others, from Mr. Robot or Bohemian Rhapsody. The main character works at the CIA headquarters in Langley as an extremely talented cryptologist. His seemingly simple and routine life changes completely when his wife Sarah (Rachel Brosnahan) is killed in a terrorist attack in London. Charlie does everything to convince his superiors to take action to catch and punish the perpetrators, but when they refuse you, he decides to take matters into his own hands. He uses his intelligence and skills to do justice to his beloved's killers. The plot may seem simple, predictable and give the impression of "I've seen it somewhere before", but it still draws you in and encourages you to follow the further fate of the characters. The pace of the film is a bit slow, but in my case it didn't make me bored - on the contrary, the story engaged me more and more. It can be said that this is a "one-man army action" film, but it differs from classic examples of this type. Charlie is not John Wick or Nathan Cain from Novocaina - he cannot kill a man with his bare hands. Instead of brute force, he uses his mind, knowledge and analytical skills, which adds freshness to the film. Rami Malek here is somewhat reminiscent of Elliot from Mr. The robot, although in this role, is more human - not cold and feelingless, but frightened, incapable of violence, but ready to sacrifice. It is worth mentioning that Jon Bernthal appears in the film and in my opinion his character does not play a major role. He appears maybe in three scenes and that's it. Laurence Fishburne plays a character somewhat reminiscent of Morpheus from The Matrix or King Bowery from John Wick, although here he plays rather a villain - although whether he is really bad can be debated. To be honest, it's hard for me to point out the disadvantages of this film that I didn't notice them because I was too absorbed in the plot. In short: I really liked the movie. To sum up - The Amateur is an interesting action thriller. It may seem like something we've already seen somewhere, but it's still worth giving it a chance and watching it, whether in the cinema or at home. I recommend.

The Amateur is nothing new, but I found a good amount of fun to be had in this engaging revenge story. Rami Malek steals the show as he gives a great performance that shows the deep grief his character goes through, and I enjoyed the ways he would squirm out of tough situations like a bar of soap. It was cool seeing the way of how the film uses technology to decode the mystery of who made Rami Malek‚Äôs character a living hell, which made the action so much more fun. But I think the film takes too long for that to happen, and in the meantime we are fed a lot of different characters I found a little bland, lots of head scratching decisions made in the development of the supporting roles. Even with Rami Malek‚Äôs character, the film felt like they didn‚Äôt know how to keep his motives steady. But I think it‚Äôs an engaging enough time to watch go see it in theatres
